question: Question_01_(c)
statement:
Answer the following multiple choice question. Check your answer very
carefully. Your answer will be marked right or wrong (work will not be
considered for this problem).

Does the integral

\[\int_1^{\infty} \frac{1+\sin x} {x^{2}} \,dx\] converge?

A. Converge

B. Diverge.
sols:
Since $0 \leq 1+\sin x \leq 2$ for all \emph{x}, we use the integral
comparison test to see that

\[\int_1^{\infty} \frac{1+\sin x} {x^{2}} dx \leq \int_1^{\infty} \frac2{x^2}\,dx\]

The latter integral converges, by the integral \emph{p} test (with
\emph{p} = 2). Hence, again by the integral comparison test, the former
integral also \textbf{converges}.
hints:
First use the integral comparison test.

Then use the integral \emph{p} test.
